content: magic_ring 6 6 round 2 increase around 12 round 3 *single_crochet 1 increase 18 round 4 single_crochet 1 *increase single_crochet 2 until last stitch single_crochet 1 24 round 5 *single_crochet 3 increase 30 round 6 2 single_crochet *increase single_crochet 4 until last 2 stitches single_crochet 2 36 rounds 7-10 single_crochet around 36 round 11 *single_crochet 5 increase 42 rounds 12-14 single_crochet around 42 round 15 *single_crochet 5 decrease 36 round 16 single_crochet 2 *decrease single_crochet 4 until last 2 stitches single_crochet 2 30 round 17 *single_crochet 3 decrease 24 round 18 single_crochet 1 *decrease single_crochet 2 until last stitch 1 single_crochet 18 round 19 *single_crochet 7 decrease 16 fo attach eyes between rounds 10 and 11 approximately 8 stitches apart firmly stuff ears make 2 round 1 magic_ring 4 4 round 2 *single_crochet increase 8 round 3 single_crochet around 8 round 4 *single_crochet 1 single_crochet increase 12 round 5 single_crochet around 12 round 6 *single_crochet 2 single_crochet increase 16 round 7 single_crochet around 16 round 8 *single_crochet 3 single_crochet increase 20 fo leaving long tail for sewing do not stuff the ears arms make 2 round 1 magic_ring 5 5 round 2 single_crochet increase around 10 round 3 * single_crochet 1 increase 15 rounds 4-6 single_crochet around 15 round 7 * single_crochet 1 decrease 10 round 8-10 single_crochet around 10 fo and leave tail for sewing lightly stuff tail round 1 magic_ring 6 6 round 2 single_crochet around 6 repeat round 2 until tail measures 5 inches cut a piece of pipe cleaner to 10 inches and fold in half thread through tail in order to be able to choose tail position assembly sew the head the body with eyes facing forward embroider a tiny t shaped nose on the face between the eyes at row 12 and 13 approximately 1-2 stitches across in pale pink thread sew ears to the head starting at round 3 to round 10 on each side of the face the sew the arms in place just under the head sew the tail to the back of the body and tie a ribbon in a bow around the neck to finish thank you for purchasing this pattern i would love to see your finished product you can share your photos on my facebook page tag me on twitter @zocreates or instagram @zoe creates and you can use the hashtag #zoecreates
